properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 8:17PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Kentucky...

Green River at Paradise and Calhoun

.Runoff from rainfall forecast over the next 48 hours will cause
the Green River at Paradise and at Calhoun to rise into moderate
flood stage. At Paradise, the river is forecast to crest on Saturday.
At Calhoun, the river is forecast to crest on Sunday.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Green River at Calhoun
* from Thursday morning until further notice.
* At  7:00 PM Tuesday the stage was 22.2 feet.
* Flood Stage is 23.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late Thursday morning and
continue to rise to near 27.5 feet by Sunday morning. Additional
rises are possible thereafter.
* Impact...At 26.0 Feet...Moderate flooding occurs with thousands of
acreage flooded in the Island, Rumsey, and Jewel City areas.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
